briefdescription.para: A python object container for the logger object for outputting using python's logging module.
A python object container for the logger function call for outputting using python's logging module.

memberdef.name: DispersalMethods
memberdef.initializer: = { {"set_map_parameters", set_map_parameters, METH_VARARGS, "Sets the map parameters for the dispersal simulation."}, {"set_pristine_map_parameters", set_pristine_map_parameters, METH_VARARGS, "Sets the pristine map parameters for the dispersal simulation."}, {"set_dispersal_parameters", set_dispersal_parameters, METH_VARARGS, "Sets the dispersal parameters for the dispersal simulation."}, {"test_mean_dispersal", test_mean_dispersal, METH_VARARGS, "Simulates the dispersal function on the provided map, recording the mean dispersal distance."}, {"test_mean_distance_travelled", test_mean_distance_travelled, METH_VARARGS, "Simulates the dispersal function on the provided map," " recording the mean distance travelled in the number of steps."}, {"set_log_function", set_log_function, METH_VARARGS, "calls logging"}, {"set_logger", set_logger, METH_VARARGS, "Sets the logger to use"}, {nullptr, nullptr, 0 , nullptr} }

parameterdescription.para: arguments to parse, should contain all key map parameters
arguments to parse, should be lists of the fine and coarse map parameters

briefdescription.para: Simulates the provided dispersal kernel on the map file, saving the mean dispersal distance to the output database.

parameterdescription.para: the arguments passed in from python

simplesect.para: Py_None if successful, otherwise will return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Simulates the provided dispersal kernel on the map file, saving the mean distance travelled to the output database.

parameterdescription.para: the arguments passed in from python

simplesect.para: Py_None if successful, otherwise will return NULL.

briefdescription.para: Contains the functions for testing dispersal methods using efficient c++ routines.
